Review.Contenu: Very high pressure sell, assuring recovery.  Misstated fees and handling costs which created surprises.  Once media was received, I received a note stating they would be able to recovery the data.  I later learned this wasn't true, but they could attempt additional recovery methods for an additional fee.  Our media was lost when shipping back to us.  SecureDataRecovery's response was 'they submitted a claim to the shipping company.'  We not only wasted our money, but now do not have the media to attempt to get it fixed anywhere else.  It contained all childhood pictures of our kids from birth to present.  Gone forever!  Do not use!

Somethings wonky here.  I sent in my SDD after consulting with one of their agents, Val.A few days later he emailed me and said that it was "damaged beyond repair" and that I'd need to pay them more money to have it shipped back to me.I responded by asking if I was going to receive a diagnostic report or was I just supposed to take them at their word and send them more money?I paid to have it returned, and he never responded to my question about the report. Just thanked me for doing business with them.I don't recommend.

Review.Titre: They don’t answer emails… I requested…
Review.Contenu: They don’t answer emails… I requested back the drive that they couldn’t recover but they just ignored it. I repeatedly send emails and then I called  to notify them that they’re ignoring my requests and they heard me but still choose to ignore and never returned my drive.

After reading the few but clear one star reviews I got concerned, as soon as I asked for how their "no data no payment" guarantee works, or how and when I would get my device back Elliot´s response and attitude changed letting me know they will not provide any assurance, even to the point of stating he could not send me the standard terms I would have to commit once their free diagnostics finished! I´ve done my research and found they in fact will not respond nor quote in a transparent manner.

Review.Titre: These guys were not honest with me
Review.Contenu: These guys were not honest with me. Sent in a hard drive to be recovered and they said they could fix it for $1400 when all that was wrong was the enclosure of the drive. I later on found out that all I had to do was remove it from the enclosure and plug in the drive and my files would show up. I’m not an expert with this but a friend explained this to me later on and showed me after I received the drive back. Felt like I was scammed and was mistreated. Wish companies would be honest with this kind of service.

SHIPPER BEWARE. READ THIS if you are mailing/shipping your hard drive to them. There is nothing SECURE here. I hope to save anyone here who made the same mistake I did. DO NOT SEND YOUR HARDDRIVE TO THEM if you plan on relying on their shipping, which is basically relying on the awful company that FED EX is (rampant theft and lost packages with no liability). I made the huge mistake of accepting SECURE DATA RECOVERY‘s offer for overnight shipping, which they claimed to have ‘insured.‘ For anyone reading this, PLEASE, if you value your hard drive and priceless data, ALWAYS, take out THIRD PARTY INSURANCE in order to save your data if anything happens to your hard drive. If your hard drive is lost (or STOLEN, like mine was) then third party insurance ‘might‘ lessen the blow financially. The most important thing to know is that the insurance they use through Fed Ex, means ABSOLUTELY NOTHING, since Fed Ex only compensates up to 100 dollars for any lost or stolen package, with or without insurance. To make a long story short, they overnighted my hard drive ( from Fort Lauderdale, Florida) via Fed Ex with insurance. Their main office is in Ohio. My package arrived in an empty and open box to the Fed Ex in Ohio. The package had made it to their main Fed Ex Hub in Memphis Tennessee location, so apparently either someone working at Fed Ex stole my hard drive from the Memphis location, or they stole it at the Ohio facility. In the end these companies could care less since they are covered legally in the fine print.Overall, the response from Secure Data Recovery was pretty deadpanned and 'procedural' with minimal words or feedback. No real apologies. All they could do was file a claim with Fed Ex for $100.00 compensation and they tacked on $60 dollars for their ‘estimate’ of what my hard drive cost. My wish for them is that they would have a disclaimer on their website regarding their shipping options. Yes, it‘s obvious that anyone runs a risk sending their package anywhere, but why would you work a company that has been experiencing more and more cases of theft. And why would you not WARN your potential customers of this happening? Overall, if I could rewind, I would never ever ever ship my hard drive anywhere. Lesson learned. I would work with someone local even if more expensive. DO NOT take a chance and rely on what shipping companies have become these days.

Terrible experience.  Poor customer service. Strung along with empty promises.  Initially dropped their USD price by 50% with promises of 98% recovery. I was wary of the price drop but decided to go ahead.  Service update requests were ignored. Five months later, nothing had happened & when I wanted my drive back, I was told that if I waited 4 more days it would be complete.  Two hours later received an email indicating "the drive had been deemed unrecoverable".  Ridiculous!

Review.Titre: 508 usd spent for a useless officerecovery software
Review.Contenu: I bought their office file recovery software for 508 usd that happened to be a great scam. It hasn't worked properly on one single file when I was finally able to recover the files with another software. I asked for a refund as they claim to have a satisfaction customer policy on their website but I was answered that they don't refund sales...So I actually spent 508 usd for nothing... just get away from this company... if they do this for a software, I can't imagine their ethic with their data recovery lab...

Review.Titre: "Supposedly great" but can't get data off a Time Capsule
Review.Contenu: My husband sent in my Time Capsule that crashed weeks ago. Now they are telling him they might not be able to recover the data. Let me guess, they will hold my Time Capsule hostage until they get a huge payment. May have to get the Attorney General involved.Note to the company: When you read this, don't bother responding with your excuses, reasoning, etc. because I'm not the one who wants to hear it. Just send me my !@#$ing drive back. Thank you.

Review.Titre: We paid over 1k for our data and never…
Review.Contenu: We paid over 1k for our data and never received. 9/1/2020 is when I placed my order. It's 4/21/21. I want a refund of the $1140I paid.  I have sent numerous of emails and the representatives  were very nasty with me. We asked to be refunded but was ignored. I have all correspondence with the representatives. I will be filing a small claim against this company. I wouldn't recommend them. My service number CDS-235330

Review.Titre: Secure Data Recovery has been a disaster.
Review.Contenu: Secure Data Recovery has had my computer for over a month and has been completely unresponsive.  They damaged my computer screen and have not returned multiple calls and emails regarding my initial request.  I read all of the great reviews on the company and went to them because I needed help.  My experience has been a disaster and has me questioning the legitimacy of the company.

Unresponsive and terrible Customer service. It took weeks on average for my calls and emails to be answered. Staff would transfer me around, tell me messages were being delivered, promise call backs, and nothing would happen. I first send my hard drive in, they told me the job was complete but thousands of files didn't work and they never told me. I had to mail my hard drive in a 2nd time for them to tell me they can't do anything and they refused a refund. It took weeks of asking to finally get my hard drive returned to me and a refund issued. Working with Secure Data Recovery was a terrible experience and no one should have to go through that.

Review.Titre: Solid state hard drive wouldn't load…
Review.Contenu: Solid state hard drive wouldn't load up, "I/o error".   Brought it down to this company and gave to them for their shipment.   Turns out the drop off location is simply a secretary at a multi-use space.    There was no physical damage to the hard drive.   Response the next day (good) was severe external damage to the hard drive, $4200+ recovery.   So they trashed the hard drive while in their possession, and want to charge for recovery on the damaged drive.   What a bunch of frauds.

Review.Titre: I would not trust Secure Data Recovery
Review.Contenu: I would not trust Secure Data Recovery.  I had them do diagnostics on a external drive.  They came back with their findings and a quote to do the work.  The amount they quoted was too expensive for me so I asked them to return my hard drive, which they did.  I then sent my hard drive to another agency to get another opinion.  I was shocked when the second data recovery company informed me that the ROM chip on my printed circuit board was missing.  I then called Secured Data back to ask them why my ROM chip was missing and they couldn't tell me.  I told them that the hard drive was to be returned to me in the same condition it was sent to them.  They had no explanation as to where my ROM chip was.  It leads me to believe that Secure Data is deceitful and not an honest company to do business with.

Review.Titre: Expect data recovery for a thousands not hundreds
Review.Contenu: Expect data recovery for a thousand and a half to three thousand dollars. That is a basic recovery no fire or water damage. Just a bad chip board.  The chip board cost is $75. I think it is wrong they ransom your data.

Review.Titre: IF YOU DON'T WANT TO LOSS MONEY, DON'T USE THEM
Review.Contenu: They will lie to you to make a sale and then try to hide behind a NO REFUND policy. I sent in my hard drive to see if any videos could be saved for my YouTube channel. I pay 2500 for the recovery, initial was 3300. I received the hard drive and when I check their "GOOD LIST" of recovered data with my videos. Half of them are folders with word doc no videos or even damaged videos to be used. I start the charge back process and  they tell my bank. I'm trying to commit fraud. Out of the 78 video folders only 40 work and had videos on their "GOOD LIST". I will post my experience on every forum or review board possible to out them for their shady practices. DO NOT USE THEM you have been warned!

Review.Titre: Looked into data recovery services for…
Review.Contenu: Looked into data recovery services for my personal 8TB hard drive with mostly movies (recently ripped and disposed of DVDs). Hard drive was part of a WD My Book, would not connect to computer via USB 3.0. Computer would connect and disconnect every 5 seconds in an infinite loop. Secure Data Recovery proposed $1500 for data recovery, but when I declined their services, my "Data Recovery Specialist" wanted to know what I was willing to spend to see if there an "option with a longer recovery timeline" that would better meet my needs. So, I bought a $40 USB3.0 to SATA hard drive dock and was able to access and transfer my data. I would recommend fully evaluating all other options before over paying for this service.

Review.Titre: Quoted Price Well Above Verbally Expected Price
Review.Contenu: I initially had a good experience with this company. The rep (Anthony) was responsive and talked me through the process. I was told to expect about $500-600 for the problem I was having based on my hardware. The shipping and diagnostic was free so why not? I sent my computer, took over a week to hear back, and the quote was over $2900. About 6 times more than I was told to expect. Company wouldn't budge on the price, which is fine, but they charged me $30 to get my computer back. There was a lot of talk about free shipping and free diagnostics, but no talk about paying for return shipping if you decline their quote which is 6x more than expected. If this company was serious about value and their customers, they would have covered the return fee and not tried to lure me in with promises of a fair price. I hope your experience is better.

After and getting an overview of their services and process for a laptop I needed the data recovered from, I sent my mechanical and solid state drives for them to inspect. They informed me there was no data on the mechanical drive and they would need to inspect the ssd. At this point they asked me to send the ssd to them. Per their original instruction I had already sent both together. They had no record of receiving it or having it. They claim to have a video of ‘unboxing’ my drives that shows the ssd wasn’t included, but refuse to share the video. My assumption is the ssd got discarded with the packaging, as it was wrapped in foam but still fairly small. They’ve offered no remedy, or even apology. I now have no option to try to recover that data with them or anyone else.I can not recommend this company by any means. I strongly warn against sending your drive(s) away to them. Huge thumbs down.

Totally overpriced.. wanted to surprise my wife with data from her old hard drive, but the experience with Secure Data was terrible.  Initially they wanted to charge me $945 dollars to do the recovery, and when I said it was too much they discounted it to $500 dollars to recover 66 GB of data. I was still not pleased with this pricing and knew that I could probably get it alot cheaper locally I decided if I did a payment plan it was ok since I was dealing with so many things going on at home. So I agreed to do the recover,  and when it was ready they also make you purchase a hard drive from them.  Their options are 1TB 2TB and 3TB.  I only have 66GB of data why would I need a 1TB drive.  I would not recommend using these guys, look elsewhere, they are trying to get over.  I have gotten quotes since then and I have quotes of 200-300 dollars roughly.  Be smart and look around before you try these guys because they will take advantage of you

This company might do OK work but they are terrible humans to work with. After working with another data company to retrieve my data that didn't go well, I went to Secure Data to hopefully retrieve the data, which they were able to (partially) do, which is why I can give them 1 star. However in the process, they tried to slander the other company I worked with, and sent them legal documents for signature in which I had the legal contract with them, that they didn't uphold to. How unethical is that?!? Yikes! Then on top of that they said they recovered all my data in which they only got about 1/4th of it, and told me I needed to prove what was missing (sorry I failed to take a photo of the drive capacity before it was accidentally damaged, I think that's a very unreasonable expectation). And when I did find holes in the recovery they said "that isn't enough holes" to warrant further investigation. This could have been resolved with simple communication, however during all this they wouldn't answer their phones (cowards?) so it could only be discussed over email. What kind of company does that? You might get OK work, but you will get truly horrible customer service. Just watch out before you go to them before data recovery!

Review.Titre: My experience with Secure Data Recovery…
Review.Contenu: My experience with Secure Data Recovery has been awful. I highly recommend looking for a different company to recover your data.TLDR: Their actual price is way more expensive than the service they provide. They never returned the drive I sent in for repair. It's under warranty but without the drive I can't get it replaced.I had a hard drive failure in August of 2021. I reached out to this company for a quote. Although they were hesitant to give me a range they told me the services I was asking for generally was between 600 - 1k. A bit pricey but I moved ahead with it as my drive was under warranty and if I wanted it replaced I needed to use a place that was certified by the drive company. When I sent in the drive the quote came back north of 2k. If I had known that was a possibility I would have shopped around to check out other places. After calling to complain about this multiple times, and being shuffled around from my original contact, they brought the price down to 1k. Which although expensive I was thankful for and was able to commit to. They recovered a fair amount of my files but not all. 500 gb out of 2 tb. They sent me a new drive, but never returned the old drive so I could send it in under the warranty. I followed up about 4-5 times via phone after not hearing back over 3 emails. Finally they said they would send the drive back, and when they did sent it to the wrong address. Supposedly fed ex's fault. After following up again and being guaranteed it would be rectified it's now February of 2022 and I have yet to get the drive back. At this point I'm not even sure I'll still be under warranty if they ever do get the drive back. DO NOT USE THEM!

The files on my hard drive disappeared and I took my desktop to BKB Tech in San Jose who recommended that I send my hard drive to Secure Data in Southern California.  I contacted them and chose the option that would recover up to 1.5 terabytes and take about 14 days.  The cost was $1,661.On July 20th, they received my hard drive. In the next month or so, left a number of messages for Eric Dvorin, my Secure Data rep, but got no response until I mentioned the calls to the tech at BKB Tech.  Eric finally called and said they were working on my hard drive. On September 14, I got an email saying the recovery was complete.  After picking up my PC at BKB Tech , I found out that most of the files came back in RAW format without titles.  It took me a while to go through and rename them.  When I finished, I found that none of the tax or business files I desperately needed were there.  Many of the photos were corrupted.  I think I picked the wrong company to recover my data.  In addition to only getting a fraction of my files, I was extremely disappointed with the extra five weeks they took to return my files and the lack of communication from Secure Data.  On September 16, two days after the recovery was “complete”, I got the following email message from Eric: “Also, if I were to send you over a link to our Secure Data Recovery review page would you mind posting about my customer service? We have a little contest in the office and if I finish in the top 3 for the month the company will treat my kids, wife and I to dinner. Please let me know and I will send you the link.”  As you might imagine, I didn’t ask him for the link. Based on my very disappointing experience, I would not recommend this company.

Review.Titre: Be Warned: Horrible Experience and Nothing Recovered
Review.Contenu: In November I experienced a catastrophic hard drive failure, and spoke to Jonathan Nguyen at Secure Data Recovery Services.I sent in my hard drive for the diagnostics, paying the $295.00 for expedited analysis. I was told that there was physical damage, but that the data looked to be recoverable.After agreeing to expedited service (2-5 business days), and pre-authorizing the payment, everything started to go wrong. Getting information was painful, I had to constantly chase down the status of what was happening, and I kept being told the engineers were working on my drive.I didn't even receive standard turn around at 5-9 business days. They received my hard drive on Nov 8th, 2021.  I did not receive the "recovered" files back until Thursday Dec 2nd, 2021. 26 days total until I received back a new drive with the supposedly "recovered files".After finally receiving this drive nothing on it was accessible.  Every file I tried to open was corrupted, even the ones that were supposedly marked good.  Most of the files had garbage characters written in there that said "Data Recover Labs ?????????" written over and over again. 99% of the files were stripped from their file structure, renamed with numbers, and stuck in a folder by "file type". Most of my file types, like Adobe Illustrator and Adobe InDesign were gone. The Adobe Photoshop files were all corrupt and wouldn't open, same with the jpeg files. It's one thing to tell me that the files can't be recovered - it's another to pretend they can, and send me back a drive where none of my files can be opened.  I was extremely clear up front that these were graphics files, that I was a graphic artist, and these were my critical files.  These were all on a mac formatted drive and were large Adobe Photoshop, Adobe InDesign and Adobe Illustrator files primarily, with jpg and png also.  I told the company that average files sizes were 50MB to 300mb and made it clear these were business files, not a hard drive full of personal mementos.Not only did I receive things back in a "file type recovery" format where all file structure was stripped, but it renamed every file so I had no clue what it was.  That too could have been dealt with if a single one of these files would open. They do not.  Not one of the psd files, not one of the jpeg files.  My Adobe InDesign files that had a file extension of .indd are just flat missing.I'm beyond disappointed in how this was handled.  At any point they could have told me that they didn't have experience with these large graphics files, or that their software was going to destroy the files, or that they didn't have experience with mac files. They didn't even tell me that my drive had been re-shipped off to Chicago instead of Los Angeles, and couldn't even get the shipping back to me with the correct method. Instead I was strung along for almost a month, while my business suffered waiting to hear whether anything could be recovered or if it all had to be rebuilt from scratch.I reached out to the company again and told them I was willing to pay the $295 for the diagnostics, the cost of the new hard drive they sent back, and a reasonable $500 fee for the work they did to access the physical drive. But I cannot pay $3,752.37 for "recovered files" that can't be opened.  That is simply unacceptable, not to mention ethically reprehensible.After giving them another 12 days to get back to me and make this right, I once again heard nothing from them and have proceeded to file a dispute with my credit card company and the Better Business Bureau.

Review.Titre: Hidden fees. Lack of commitment. They won't show you the listing of salvaged data!
Review.Contenu: My name is Tavi Florian and I had a recent experience with the SDR company, which had been promising at the beginning, but turned to bitter disappointment in the end. And even to a robbing attempt from them!Now the whole story of facts:- I contacted them on e-mail, with a detailed description of my problematic hard drive, on which another recovery procedure had been done at a specialized firm in my home country, and my whishes about further recovery of files (mostly pictures) from an easy checkable listing provided by the first company (with the original file names and their structuring sorted in two groups: the valid ones and the corrupted). I also told them that in the present, the read heads are probably dead.- After a few days, my case was assigned to someone in the Ohio area, named Luke Marrali, who was saying to me (knowing all the facts) that they offer free diagnostic and the normal pricing range of 400 to 1800$, with the mention that it can be higher “if certain variables exist”. How much higher? He doesn’t said.- Then I decided against my feeling, but in favour of the reviews, to send my hard drive at SDR. - After its arrival, I went through the procedure and I authorized just the diagnostic. Then, no more than 2 hours passed, and the result came back... which was saying that the engineers are confident that they can start a successful recovery procedure. But they did not estimated any percentage of recoverable data, just that it can not be salvaged all the data because of some bad sectors. The price was about 3215$! For something very ambiguous. - Before the completion of pre-payment agreement, I gotten quickly out of there, asking the same guy for clarifications. It is unbelievable that they do not commit to anything! They won’t show you the listing of salvaged data in order to let you decide if the operation is successful or not, if you are pleased with the results! And only if you accept the results, then you should have to pay for the needed data! This way seems logical and right for me. But NO, they decide instead of you!! They are like the banks... they never take risks, never lose anything. That is why they claim such a high rate of success (96%)! What a dump head would accept to buy the same data that he already have, for a price of 26 times more expensive?!! Unbelievable policy, in contradiction with the doubled price just because another recovery had been done. Ok, high price, but show me the data and let me decide if it is satisfactory or not. - That Luke guy had become very elliptical, throwing just a few words on you. Then given their lack of commitment, I refused any further continuation and was asking for my hard back. Now, it came the stroke of this crook! I almost felt his perfidious smile on his face... saying: “Unfortunately this is an AS-IS case. You will be liable for payment either way.” - FOR WHAT, YOU CHARLATAN, WANT MONEY FROM ME?! But this type crooks never even think about the condition of their potential victims! Referring now on by background, I have to say that I was an autistic child. And now, at 40 years old, I am alone, with no job and no friends... and probably I will remain this way for ever. I never had a girlfriend in my life. And for this matter, by the way, my most important lost photo (which I wanted the most to be recovered) was a girl on the street. Unfortunately, only after this hard drive disaster I realized how much I love her... and I wanted dearly to have that picture of her to put it on my chest when the time will come. Of course... an illusory love.- The next day, I wrote to him again, repeating all my arguments. Then, with a bit of delay, he threw a reply with the “shipping fee” of 49$. This fee still looked high for me, thinking of that paying threat from Luke. And knowing the price I had paid to send it, about 19.3$.- I was also looking for a second opinion on my case, in the SDR company, writing them on facebook. Fortunately, their person on FB was nicer and I manage to communicate better with him. He made a checking in the shipping department and confirmed me the shipping fee was correct. Which was actually much smaller for companies than for a normal person. - Ok, That should be it and I paid, getting a clear invoice of 49$ for the shipping to my address in eastern Europe.- After a few quiet days, the real shock came... that Luke specimen saying the following words: “Return shipping quoted is actually $195.00 instead of $49. We cannot honor the $49.00 charge and you will have to pay the difference. We can always shred the drive for free or we can invoice you the difference.“ In the previous days, it just seemed that they had given up to charge me for the “AS-IS case”.From time to time, big companies might do charitable acts, but for this kind of scumbags it is a huge challenge just to respect the deal, to be FAIR and have clear fees! The “charitable act” of rightness was a huge challenge for that specimen! He failed! Again me on facebook and manage to sorted out on Friday (without knowing for sure)... and finally, on Tuesday next (this) week my hard came back to me surprisingly, a surprise on the good side this time, without any sending confirmation from them. - Finally, such a waste of time, energy, hopes and money! But I still keep a minimal hope.IN CONCLUSION:1. I got fooled by the good reviews, BIG TIME! Wanting to be optimistic and see only the good parts.2. With this SDR company, there is no phrase like this: “we bring your data where others have failed”. A long review, but the experience was shocking for me, in relation with the size of this company and its public quotation.

Review.Titre: Took over 2 months to get me back my…
Review.Contenu: Took over 2 months to get me back my drive because of internal miscommunication despite multiple calls on my part.

Review.Titre: Pictures look fine in the thumbnail…
Review.Contenu: Pictures look fine in the thumbnail images but when opened most of the pictures are blacked out.

Review.Titre: Very expensive and I didn’t get back…
Review.Contenu: Very expensive and I didn’t get back what I was hoping for

Review.Titre: The original request to recover a…
Review.Contenu: The original request to recover a specific document- the only important document on the failed drive, was ignored on numerous occasions. Instead, I was sent an enormous text document which couldn't be opened by any common software to "verify". Again I simply wanted one document recovered. The company failed to produce the document and wanted more money. I was disappointed to the point of just paying the agreed sum and cutting my losses. It then took 6 months to get my original drive back.I CAN NOT recommend that anyone to use this company for recovery. I had high hopes but was disappointed.

The staff were nice, informed and professional, although there was a lack of coordination which led to poor communication. Moreover, the pricing policies seemed predatory without being upfront. My small job took several days for the free analysis and when I followed up was going to be more than $1000. After expressing my concern the estimate was lowered by almost half. Ultimately i took it to a local computer repair shop who retrieved all my data for $75.My biggest complaints are that SDR is slow to respond, not proactive, unorganized, and their pricing seems to take advantage (hijacking emergency situations). If there is a positive it is that their staff are very friendly.

How this company could put someone like luke in customer service is beyond me?!! Never returned my calls. Had to email back and forth. Very short in explanations. When calls were returned it was if i was bothering him. To the point when i asked what time did he go home he responded "Now" and hung up.Then he forgot we'd discussed overnight shipment!! Had i not caught the overnight shipment error who knows when i would've gotten my computer.I held my tongue on a few occasions and after the money i spent thought i deserved better treatment.I could continue but you get the gist.

Review.Titre: Lack of responsiveness and unclear information about turnaround time and price
Review.Contenu: Sure, they recovered almost all the data I have lost, and that's practically really all I wanted from them. However, there are several points that should be improved during the process.1. Their customer account portal. This is very nice, but needs some improvements. Once you chose the turnaround time from several estimates, the customer account portal will NEVER show you which turnaround time you chose. I actually felt they had slightly passed the estimated time of completion of data recovery, but as the turnaround time is NEVER shown either in the portal nor in any email notification, I could not claim my right to any discount due to their (not sure, as I cannot confirm anywhere, but possible) delay in their process.  I think I ordered an expedited (2-4 days?) plan, but it took them a week (5 days) to complete the process. This is an issue related to the expensive price--customers surely pay a lot; let them know exactly the correct information about the price and time.2. Many reviews here write that they are responsive. I cannot believe it. I requested for updates through customer portal several times, as I felt the process was behind the promised turnaround time, which was due to the issue 1 mentioned above, but they replied only once, which was from a technician and was indeed relieving. It is okay, I know you are busy, and all I want from you is data recovery, period. But if you cannot reply to update requests, it might be better to delete that function in the customer portal. Also, the customer service representative responded to my multiple email questions only once during the process and ignored all the remaining questions. It is, again, okay, as I was clearly in a panic or too worried and most of my questions probably looked stupid to them; data recovery is most important, and the remainder is, after all, nothing. Still, this lack of responsiveness was enough to make me wonder about the quality of the customer service itself. Overall, extremely frustrating and not worth the extravagantly expensive price. I posted this review on Google, but somehow it does not show up on Google Reviews. Most of the reviews on Google are written by those with only one review.

Review.Titre: Jabe was polite but the experience…
Review.Contenu: Jabe was polite but the experience seemed 'sterile'. It seemed automated. Lacked a human touch. In fact I felt Jabe was a pseudonym.

Beware!  Services are SUPER EXPENSIVE.  That deserves 1 star. SDR delivered as promised, that deserves 5 stars, and within a several weeks, so that rated 3 stars.  Average is 3 stars.  But cost of service was at prohibitive level except that I had no choice.  My impression was that this felt like a ransomware attack only the cost to me was over $4,000 instead of several million$.

Review.Titre: I'm going to leave a generous 3-rating.
Review.Contenu: I'm going to leave a generous 3-rating.Secure Data absolutely did recover an external hard drive for me which contained files that had significant sentimental value.  Do I think this should have cost $1,000?  No, I think that's a bit steep for data recovery, but if you want your files, that's what you pay.  So for data recovery services, it's 4 or 5 stars.The problem is that the level of customer service I received was pretty terrible for something costing $1,000.  I had follow-up questions about what could be the possible reasons why my hard drive failed, and if there might be anything I could do to prevent this from happening again.  After I agreed to pay the $1,000, Secure Data never responded to another email I sent.  Nothing.  I had questions, I got no answers, and not even a response.  Secure Data absolutely can recover your files, but at a very high price point, and don't expect any answers to your questions, or any responses at all.  Pretty terrible customer service for this price.

I appreciated the responsive communication and follow-up. However, I feel as though pricing was dishonest. I needed a very basic service, however was quoted a price that was far too high for the service that was actually needed. When I inquired further about the actual issue and asked for a price adjustment accordingly, it was then offered and explained in better detail. From my perspective, I should not have been sent “standard” pricing and been provided a fair price from the beginning based on the actual issues with my data/computer. Once the price was agreed upon and the actual issue clarified, service was fast.

Review.Titre: 7 months since I contacted Secure Data
Review.Contenu: 7 months since I contacted Secure Data, my case still has not been resolved today. I always have to do the follow-up because there doesn't seem to be any urgency to get my case completed. Kyle is the only one there who has been really nice to make sure my questions and concerns were answered, but he's the tech lead who can only do so much.

I would have assigned 5 stars, but I was given no help finding the Emails on the secure drive.  They were an especially important part of the recovery process. I still can't find these files after many weeks.

Review.Titre: Replaced about 50% of data on over ridden hard drive
Review.Contenu: The people I worked with were pleasant.  The tech hours hours were difficult to work within.  I actually had to take time off work three times to review what was pulled off my bad hard drive. The techs were pleasant and patient when it took me so long to complete the review.

Review.Titre: The price of recovery was way too much…
Review.Contenu: The price of recovery was way too much for me.

While I appreciate the responsiveness of the person assigned to assist me, I feel that some things regarding the recovery of data, especially with a tablet, should have been made clear up front.  While I do have my information, I have been (so far) unable to access it.  I've had to download programs to my laptop that are clearly meant for people who program. Unfortunately I had to have my laptop had to be wiped clean so I have to try and start again.

Scott was very communicative and patient with me and my questions.  Unfortunately, not all of my lost data could be successfully retrieved, but I have full confidence in Secure Data and their ability to do the best job possible.  They kept me updated throughout the process and took the worry off my shoulders.  I would definitely recommend them.

SecureDataRecovery was able to retrieve more than a GB of data I thought lost after one of my external hard drives failed.  While the price tag is somewhat steep, it is understandable given the nature of the work and the fact they have to pay for a secure drive to return the data.  I thought their service was quick, efficient, and well worth the cost.

Review.Titre: The whole process went smooth with…
Review.Contenu: The whole process went smooth with quick turn around. The customer service manager I was assigned (Scott McMaken) handeled everything in a very professional manner. The only thing keeping this from a five star review is the price. WOW, data recovery is expensive.

Review.Titre: Your company did what it promised
Review.Contenu: Your company did what it promised, it recovered most (but not all) of my files, in a timely manner. The four stars instead of five has to do with the incredibly complicated, encrypted, pass-word protected digital hard drive that required an app to access. In my opinion, 99% unnecessary. An email password to me should have been sufficient.

Also, you did not return my old drives initially but did later after I requested them.  I also felt the charges were a little excessive and should have been based on what was recovered rather than the base price I seemed to have been billed.

Review.Titre: I am very grateful for the excellent…
Review.Contenu: I am very grateful for the excellent customer service that I received from Randall and Secure Data Recovery team. They were able to recover all of my data and sent it back to me on a brand new drive. It’s a very expensive process but I am very relieved that they were able to help me!

Secure Data Recovery provided great customer service and their project management system was pretty transparent.  They were able to recover all of my files. My only issues were that sometimes there were some communication disconnects with my contact person (but others handled my concerns) and that the service seemed very expensive.  Of course, I do not know the costs they incur or what industry benchmarks are, but for those who need data and can't afford it, prospects would be prohibitive.

It was expensive, but ultimately something that we really have to do. The most important data files were recovered, some of which was work done over a lifetime. Look at it this way. We always repair the car, even though we know one day it dies. Our own work, should live forever.

Review.Titre: The drivers on my tower broke and I…
Review.Contenu: The drivers on my tower broke and I lost my pictures, music, and videos from the previous 5 years. I went to two places that claimed everything was lost. Secure Data was able to save the files within 5 days and I received my external hard drive 8 days later

Personally it is not a major issue as my intent was to edit and enhance many of the photos anyway. I will say SDR did not fall short of fulfilling their performance guarantee. Representative "Val" did a great job answering questions and facilitating the process, the data recovery was better than expected (99% recovery) and performed within the quoted timeframe, but the cost seemed high (hence the 4/5 stars).

This is one of those services you don''t hope to need frequently but if we ever do again this is where we''ll go.

Mitchell was helpful explaining what went wrong with my drive without making me feel stupid. The recovery was on schedule and within budget.  And they were able to retrieve all of my files!

Review.Titre: Stress free service for a stressful situation

I will definitely continue using Security Data Recovery if I ever need to.

Though I wasn't able to my drive fixed due to financial reasons, Elijah offered some of the best customer service I have ever come across. Having been in customer service myself, Elijah offered fast replies to my emails and questions. Thanks again Eli!

This was priced for a 67 GB, a price we cannot refuse due to the fact of our external hard drive contained all the pictures of family whom has passed.

I worked with Jeff Hart on the repair of my hard drive. His customer service was above and beyond. He was quick to respond and was very thorough in the process. I appreciate his help and would recommend this service to anyone in need.Erica

I used Secure Data due to an unexpected breakdown in my computer and was happy that they were able to recover all my data for me and save me a lot of potential trouble.   I will not hesitate to recommend them to any associates who come across similar problems.

Review.Contenu: Great service! Secure Dara Recovery is a great service, I had no ptoblems through out the process and they were very good at keeping me updated as the recovery process proceded and made sure I understood the next steps in the process.

Posted Jan 14, 20227 months since I contacted Secure Data7 months since I contacted Secure Data, my case still has not been resolved today. It should have features that may include, but not limited to: point-of-contact info, SLA (Service Level Agreements) management, start-to-end resolution status. Good luck! Thank you, Secure Data Recovery!

Excellent communication.  Very professional and personable.  Thanks for the attempts to retrieve the data.

We had been fortunate to not have needed hdd recovery services until now, so we needed to choose a provider we could trust in short order with no prior experience.  Reviews and certifications were helpful to make the choice.  Our initial call in for help was good  - the account rep was helpful, clear, and friendly. Sending in the drive was easy. The rep we worked with throughout the process  - Jeremy Provchy - was prompt and courteous and took the time to explain issues as they arose. He was able to be flexible on the fee, and even responded to questions during off hours and weekends.   It took a little bit to sort through the remains of the data and figure out how exactly the process for retrieving files worked, but in the end we got back a significant portion of what we needed.  We chose the option to have the data encrypted for return, and the method is pretty nice.  The drive is enclosed in a well built case and includes a usb key and software. Setup is simple. We can continue to use the drive for encrypted backups.

Review.Titre: Chris was very responsive to all of my…
Review.Contenu: Chris was very responsive to all of my concerns.  I would not hesitate to use their service again

Review.Titre: Got all the data, and that's what matters
Review.Contenu: I had a failed laptop HDD, bitlockered, from a user that was dying.  It would only mount in another computer about one out of every 5 or 6 tries... and then it would ask for the bitlocker key.  After putting it in it would only run for a few minutes and then unmount, so I couldn't get much data off at all.  Then, at one point I tried putting in the key and it told me the key was invalid... but I knew it was the right key.  I think the sectors that held the key on the disk probably got corrupted... I couldn't do anything else, so I sent it so Secure Data Recovery.   They ran in to the same issue with the bitlocker key being incorrect... but on a whim I pulled up an OLD bitlocker key from well over a year ago... and apparently that worked!  I have no idea how.  But needless to say, they were able to recover all the data, so it was a success. The only improvement I could suggest is that it took quite some time, and updates on the status were not always forthcoming unless requested.  It ended up taking quite a while to get the data back to me, in part because I had to send out a separate hard drive for the recovery to a part of their business in another state... a few weeks, ultimately.
Great customer service and product delivery! 4 stars only because the price is extremely high.

Review.Titre: The process was easy and timely
Review.Contenu: The process was easy and timely. I feel it's a bit pricey though.

Dear Secure Data Recovery:Thank you SO much for all you did to recover ALL of my data. Elijah was professional, helpful, and affable. He patiently led me through a lot of issues and questions, and I have a feeling I shall be calling back. In terms of suggestions for possible improvement, I think it would be helpful going in to let people know a bit more of what the prices are--I was initially told the baseline fee was $400, so when I found out that the minimum fee I would be paying was over $1,400, there was a bit of a shock. It was absolutely worth it, but a lot of people do not have the means to pay such a high price, and, if they know that going in, they may be better equipped to gauge the value of their data versus the price point. Lastly, and this just may be my issue, but the files are not easily found on the external hard drive. I know that there are 'folders inside of folders inside of folders,' but, after an admittedly quick and cursory examination, I still can't find my files without entering a specific file name. I believe it is going to require a LOT more digging, which I simply do not have the time for right now. Nonetheless, the peace of mind that has been achieved in knowing that ALL my data was recovered is immense, and I cannot thank you enough for the professional and expedient manner in which you handled my case. Special kudos to Eli!

Review.Titre: I lost access to a portable hard drive
Review.Contenu: I lost access to a portable hard drive, and was looking for a place to recover the data. The last time I had to do this was a few years back, but was not impressed with that firm, so I found Secure Data Recovery. The response from the personnel was very good, with quick turn-around time to all communications, and helpful information. They were able to recover all the data, and in a reasonably good timeframe. I had no rush for the data recovery, so I wasn't too concerned about that. The price was average, though -- about the same as other services I've used. One drawback was that Secure Data Recovery did not provide a recovery drive at cost, or even at retail prices. The base service is data recovery and you provide your own recovery drive. Secure Data Recovery will provide a recovery drive, but at significantly more cost than if you get a replacement drive and ship it to them, which is what I did. The reason for the additional cost for a higher-tier recovery plan, according to their website, is because, in addition to the replacement drive, there were additional "services". However, none of the extra "services" had any value to me at all. So that just made the cost of the drive way too much. But I did ship a replacement drive to them and they transferred the data to it and have shipped it back. So I'd come back if I need to do this again.

My experience with Secure Data Recovery was easier than expected, obviously I was nervous sending off my phone which held thousands of pictures that I wanted recovered. The original phone had tea spilled on it and it ruined the screen so that I could no longer utilize the phone, but I could tell it was still working since it was making noises. I took the computer components out and attempted to transfer to another phone with a working screen so that I could access and save my data, however that didn't work. So I searched and found Secure Data Recovery. I requested a quote, and my customer service rep, Kurt Pietrick, called and discussed what I wanted. He kept in contact with me and answered questions as I had them throughout the process. I selected the standard service and turn around was less than a month. It was more expensive than I was anticipating, approx $1200, but it was worth it to me as I had years of pictures and videos stored that i had never backed up. A few of the video files where corrupt and I couldn't view them, but overall it was a success! The only downside is that when your data is returned it is on a drive that is accessible only after you download their APP, I typically don't use APPs, so I would have preferred it to be just a password protected drive, but even following the instructions to open the drive was easy. I would use again and suggest to others.
Thank you for retrieving all my data from my damaged harddrive.

Review.Titre: Thank Goodness for Secure Data Recovery
Review.Contenu: Thank goodness for Secure Data Recovery! I had a major hard disk crash on my laptop late last year. I was beside myself when my photos from the past four years, as well as other important files, could not be salvaged by my local big-box store tech support. Worse yet, I had not properly backed up anything. Fortunately, I found Secure Data Recovery and eventually got my damaged hard disk out to them in California. I am comfortable with tech stuff to a point, but the account manager handling my case answered all of my questions and concerns and made the process easy, and he was available to answer other questions as they arose. We had a slight glitch when I was emailed someone else's recovery report, but the account manager straightened it out and the process continued smoothly. On my end, the only thing I would have changed would be to eliminate the drop-off aspect of the process and mail the disk directly. In retrospect, I instinctively knew how to properly package the damaged drive for mailing off to Secure Data Recovery and probably would have saved myself a 45-minute drive to the suggested drop-off location. Otherwise, Secure Data Recovery saved my photos and files, all within their estimated project time. I even got telephone assistance with the encrypted hard drive containing my recovered files. Secure Data Recovery is not inexpensive, but for me, the price was worth it because had I not used their services, I would have lost a considerable chunk of precious photo memories. They do offer a few pricing options for dealing with a technical problem, so that was quite helpful. Thanks to everyone at Secure Data Recovery for your technical expertise, courteous service, and truth in advertising. Hopefully, I will not go through a hard disk crash again (ever), but if I do, I know who I'm going to call.

Review.Titre: Fast service although it still hurts to…
Review.Contenu: Fast service although it still hurts to pay so much

While I hope to not need their services again, if I do, Secure Data Recovery will be the place I turn to and I would highly recommend them to others. Frederick Wright kept me up to date on the status of my hard drive recovery. I explained to Dr. Wright that I''m currently on night shift, he was very understanding and kept me informed by through email and still made me feel like I was his only customer.Out of 50k+ files, they were only unable to recover four and they provided me the names of those files. Even the return shipping through FedEx was frustration free (I typically have problems with FedEx when a signature is required).I knocked off half a star due to the way the recovered data was provided to me. Because the cable for the secure hard drive was short, I used my usb extender. The drive would unlock for about fifteen seconds and would not show up in the file manager, then would re-lock. After about thirty minutes and me starting to get frustrated, I plugged the drive directly into the computer and had no further issues. I have been unable to get the app that unlocks the drive to work without allowing access to and enabling my location. Now that I have all my data back on my computer, I will be wiping the secure drive and it will became a rather expensive paper weight. The recovered data did include some financial information that I am very happy to have back, and I''m glad that the data was secured so that that if something happened during shipping, I''m protected. Now that being said, I am sure that if I had spoken with Dr. Wright on the phone, the whole issue would probably have not existed.In summary, awesome customer service, I would use them again, but I would discuss how the data was returned a little more.
Very pricey. Wish you offered a payment plan.
Good service. Might take longer than expected.
Elliot made the entire [stressful] process as seamless and painless as possible. From my first inquiry through to follow-up when the data was returned, he was absolutely awesome.
Had a great experience. Secure data helped save my reputation by recovering necessary files for my client. They also worked with my budget.
Full recovery, great customer service, Scott was great to work with!

I cannot thank Secure Data Recovery enough.To all my fellow photographers out there, in South Carolina and elsewhere, Secure Data Recovery is a lifesaver.Jessica CarpenterLMLDSouth Carolina

He asked specific questions regarding the drive which I answered.  Thankfully, he did not seem to be patronizing as some tech support agents are when asking questions and questioning my responses.  He was brief, professional and seemed to be understanding.When I asked him approximately how much it would cost, he did dance around a bit, saying it depended on the drive, the symptoms and the underlying cause.  He provided an email w/ a link to their web page and their available recovery packages, terms & conditions as well as pricing for the recovery packages.  While I did not expect low prices, I wasn't quite prepared for the actual prices.  To be fair, they did have an option to decline service after diagnosing for "S&H fee", of $28.00; small price to pay to know if your data is recoverable or not, esp if you decide to decline the service.Successful data recovery, excellent tech support & customer service.
